TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConnectionsZoneDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> provides a design-time representation of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control with a menu to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property for the convenience of the page developer. It is the only zone designer that does not support designer regions. This is because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls uses links to create connections instead of a drag-and-drop user interface (UI).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property both appear on the verbs menu of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control. <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A>, when selected, provides a selection of color schemes. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> check box, when selected, displays the contents of the control as it would appear in the browser; the control will be empty until a connection is made.
You can inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> to support a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control as with any other control designer. You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to change the markup that renders the control. You can also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> with a custom scheme.
## Examples The following code example shows how to hide additional properties from a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method.
[!code-csharp[WebPartsDesigners_ConnectionsZoneDesigner_Overview#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebPartsDesigners_ConnectionsZoneDesigner_Overview/CS/ConnectionsZoneSample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebPartsDesigners_ConnectionsZoneDesigner_Overview#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebPartsDesigners_ConnectionsZoneDesigner_Overview/vb/connectionszonesample.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property AutoFormats As DesignerAutoFormatCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of predefined automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box for the associated control at design time.
Docs.value: A predefined with a default ConnectionZone scheme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property overrides its base implementation to get a predefined collection that is specific to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub PreFilterProperties (properties As IDictionary)

Docs.param: An of the set of properties associated with the control.
Docs.summary: Hides a preset group of properties at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method overrides the parent method to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.EmptyZoneTextStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartChromeStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartTitleStyle%2A> properties in the designer. This is because the properties in question are not rendered by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls and are therefore not relevant.
## Examples For an example of how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> class overview topic.
